author: Source: WSJV-TV South Bend
title: Indiana-born space pioneer Silverstein gets posthumous honor - WSJV-TV South Bend
text:
An Indiana-born space pioneer who played key roles in the Mercury and Apollo programs has been posthumously inducted into National Aviation Hall of Fame. Silverstein, who died in 2001 at age 92, served as NASA's first director of space flight programs from 1958 to 1969.
Start the conversation, or Read more at WSJV-TV South Bend.
